description: Verify EvidenceDetectionClient provides run() method that accepts sentence_topic_dicts
test_steps: Call run() with valid sentence_topic_dicts parameter
Verify method executes without interface errors
verification: Method signature matches expected interface from diagram and client file

description: Verify system raises error when sentence field is empty
test_steps: Create input with empty sentence: [{'sentence': '', 'topic': 'some topic'}]
verification: Error raised before any processing occurs (as shown in validation diagram)

description: Verify system raises error when topic field is empty
test_steps: Create input with empty topic: [{'sentence': 'some sentence', 'topic': ''}]
verification: Error raised before any processing occurs (validation diagram requirement)

description: Verify data transformation preserves sentence-topic pairing
test_steps: Create input with distinct sentence-topic pairs: [{'sentence': 'A', 'topic': 'T1'}, {'sentence': 'B', 'topic': 'T2'}]
Verify first score corresponds to ('A', 'T1') and second to ('B', 'T2')
verification: Transformation maintains pairing as shown in processing pipeline diagram

description: Verify batch processing handles multiple inputs correctly
verification: Single run() call processes all inputs via batch mechanism (diagram requirement)

description: Verify output returns one score per input
test_steps: Create input with N sentence-topic pairs (e.g., N=3)
Verify output is a list of length N
verification: Output cardinality matches input cardinality (service integration diagram)

description: Verify scores are numeric values in reasonable range
test_steps: Create input with valid sentence-topic pairs
Verify each score is a float or numeric type
Verify scores are in range [0, 1] (or at least reasonable bounds)
verification: Output format matches confidence score semantics from diagram

description: Verify error is raised before processing when input validation fails

description: Verify output order matches input order

verification: Required keys from input format specification and service integration diagram

description: Verify transformation happens before batch processing
test_steps: Create valid input with sentence_topic_dicts format
Verify dictionary format is accepted (not rejected)

description: Verify varied evidence strength produces varied scores
test_steps: Create strong evidence input (detailed, relevant sentence)
Create weak evidence input (vague or unrelated sentence)
Verify strong evidence scores higher than weak evidence
verification: Score semantics as confidence/probability (witness shows 0.9989 for strong vs 0.0014 for weak)

description: Verify all items are validated before any processing
test_steps: Create input where LAST item has empty sentence: [valid_pair1, valid_pair2, {'sentence': '', 'topic': 't'}]
Verify NO partial processing of valid_pair1 or valid_pair2 occurs
verification: Validation layer diagram shows validation of all inputs before processing

description: Verify batch processing aggregates results correctly
test_steps: Create large input (e.g., 10+ items to potentially span multiple batches)
Verify output is a single flat list (not nested)
Verify all input items have corresponding output scores
verification: Batch processing returns aggregated results as shown in processing pipeline Output stage
